feed.title: LinkStack Releases
feed.subtitle: Self-hosted software releases generated by selfh.st

entry.title: New release for LinkStack: v4.8.0
entry.content:
New LinkStack release (version 4.8.0)



Security Update


### New additions: - Critical security patches - Fixed cookie deletion inconsistency for session management - Now redirecting to dashboard after installing - Added unique avatar ID for theme makers - Improved info message for single user mode when installing - Custom buttons can now fetch favicons of pages protected by CAPTCHAS https://github.com/LinkStackOrg/LinkStack/commit/79dfe59289b101498789eff66178b80a087b3aec - Added Simplex button @FinnTheFoxxo - Added language zh-TW @LokiSalmonNeko - Added language GL @javiercastrode

entry.title: New release for LinkStack: v4.8.1
entry.content:
New LinkStack release (version 4.8.1)



Security + Feature Update


### New additions: **Minor changes:** - Added new social icons https://github.com/LinkStackOrg/LinkStack/pull/811 https://github.com/LinkStackOrg/LinkStack/commit/03e8fdc79aa033f8543e6020f678d023e548b5af - Backend refactoring - [Critical security fixes](#1)
# New Modular Blocks System This update introduces a modular blocks system for LinkStack, replacing the previous hard-coded blocks. You can now add community-made blocks by placing them in the new "blocks" directory, similar to themes. Blocks are self-contained add-ons that enhance your LinkStack instance, offering new features like buttons, embedded videos, and dynamic feeds. Each block is fully integrated and accessible via the blocks dropdown menu. If you are a developer and want to make your own block checkout the documentation for the block system and the example block. [Block System Documentation](https://github.com/LinkStackOrg/linkstack-blocks/wiki) [Example Block](https://github.com/LinkStackOrg/example-block) ---
### Critical security fixes A severe security vulnerability has been addressed, which previously allowed bad actors to upload malicious files. Special thanks to @aponie for identifying and assisting in resolving this issue.

# New Modular Blocks System This update introduces a modular blocks system for LinkStack, replacing the previous hard-coded blocks. You can now add community-made blocks by placing them in the new "blocks" directory, similar to themes. Blocks are self-contained add-ons that enhance your LinkStack instance, offering new features like buttons, embedded videos, and dynamic feeds. Each block is fully integrated and accessible via the blocks dropdown menu. If you are a developer and want to make your own block checkout the documentation for the block system and the example block. entry.title: New release for LinkStack: v4.8.3
entry.content:
New LinkStack release (version 4.8.3)



Security + Feature Update


### New additions: **Minor changes:** - Added new social icons https://github.com/LinkStackOrg/LinkStack/pull/811 https://github.com/LinkStackOrg/LinkStack/commit/03e8fdc79aa033f8543e6020f678d023e548b5af - Backend refactoring - [Critical security fixes](#1) - Minor bugfixes - Changed Twitter to X @MattDevTec - [Improved updater](#2)
# New Modular Blocks System This update introduces a modular blocks system for LinkStack, replacing the previous hard-coded blocks. You can now add community-made blocks by placing them in the new "blocks" directory, similar to themes. Blocks are self-contained add-ons that enhance your LinkStack instance, offering new features like buttons, embedded videos, and dynamic feeds. Each block is fully integrated and accessible via the blocks dropdown menu. If you are a developer and want to make your own block checkout the documentation for the block system and the example block. [Block System Documentation](https://github.com/LinkStackOrg/linkstack-blocks/wiki) [Example Block](https://github.com/LinkStackOrg/example-block) --- ### Critical security fixes A severe security vulnerability has been addressed, which previously allowed bad actors to upload malicious files. Special thanks to @aponie for identifying and assisting in resolving this issue. --- ### Improved updater - Resolved issues where updates could incorrectly display a successful update message when no changes were made. - Fixed a timeout error that occurred during updates. - Improved error handling. - Removed dependency: [codedge/laravel-selfupdater](https://github.com/codedge/laravel-selfupdater).

entry.title: New release for LinkStack: v4.8.4
entry.content:
New LinkStack release (version 4.8.4)



Fixes and Improvements


### New additions: - Fixed Theme Filesystem Corruption https://github.com/LinkStackOrg/LinkStack/issues/819 - Update Font Awesome to 6.7.1 https://github.com/LinkStackOrg/LinkStack/issues/854 - Added Russian language @hide-me - Added Greek language @Gvolexe - Fixed vCard Block https://github.com/LinkStackOrg/LinkStack/issues/852 - Improved stability @omgitsjan https://github.com/LinkStackOrg/LinkStack/pull/863 - [Migrate Twitter icon to X](#1) https://github.com/LinkStackOrg/LinkStack/issues/856 ### New buttons: - Updated trakt.tv logo @LeviSnoot - Added Xbox button @MattDevTec - Added threads button @MattDevTec - Added Threads social icon @MattDevTec
# Fixed Theme Filesystem Corruption > [!CAUTION] > In case the updater detects a corrupted theme filesystem, it will **permanently delete everything inside the themes directory**. Due to a change in the behavior of a function dependency, uploading themes in versions v4.8.0 to v4.8.3 caused the theme filesystem to become corrupted. This update addresses the issue. > [!TIP] > It is recommended to either manually remove any unwanted files from the themes directory or disable backups before you update if your instance is affected. --- ### Migrate Twitter icon to X The updater will now replace all existing Twitter social icons with the new X social icon. --- **Thanks to all who have contributed!** Your support is greatly appreciated.
